scenarioDescription:
The HD 211810 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 211810 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 210.81 light years away from the solar system.

HD 211810 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 211810 system


HD 211810 b

HD 211810 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2018-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.66 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 211810 b is 213.060 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 211810 b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 211810 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 211810, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 211810 - System With 1 Exoplanet
